feed.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin

entry.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
entry.summary:
In an interesting discussion on Bitcoin development, a concept was raised regarding the use of NUMS points within scriptPubKey on the blockchain. Initially, it seemed that NUMS points could be directly observed in scriptPubKey, suggesting a potential method for identifying transactions. However, further analysis revealed a crucial detail that challenges this assumption. The internal key, while being a NUMS point, undergoes a modification known as tweaking. This process alters the appearance of the NUMS point when it is used in a transaction.
The tweaked version of the internal key is what appears within the scriptPubKey on the blockchain. This adjustment has significant implications for transaction privacy and security. When a transaction using a tweaked NUMS point is completed, the specific details of the tweak are not disclosed on the blockchain. As a result, observers cannot definitively determine if a NUMS point was involved in the transaction. This characteristic ensures that the usage of NUMS points does not compromise the anonymity or fungibility of transactions on the Bitcoin network.
This nuanced understanding of NUMS points and their interaction with blockchain technology highlights the complexity of designing privacy-focused features in cryptocurrencies. It underscores the importance of thorough analysis and peer review in the development of blockchain technologies. Further details and discussions on this topic can be found in the [Bitcoin Development Mailing List](https://groups.google.com/g/bitcoindev/c/uUK6py0Yjq0/m/bQk2v0E5BQAJ), which remains a vital resource for developers and enthusiasts interested in the technical aspects of Bitcoin.
